summary: Wendy S. Collins was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents list her as an employee, including her salary and pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member during the SCAS investigation.
significance: Wendy S. Collins' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her contribution are not detailed in these documents.
